elements.title: Australian Church (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Charles Strong founded the Australian Church (building pictured) after facing heresy charges, and attracted many elite congregants including a future prime minister?

elements.title: Baek Se-hee (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Baek Se-hee wrote I Want to Die but I Want to Eat Tteokbokki?

elements.title: Eurovision Song Contest 1965 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that, after winning the Eurovision Song Contest 1965, France Gall was slapped by a fellow competitor?

elements.title: May Flint (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that some people who witnessed the sinking of the May Flint thought that it was a public display?

elements.title: Energy Polarizer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Energy Polarizer claimed to enhance the performance of Holden Commodores with crystals?

elements.title: Minecraft Monday (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that MrBeast offered a $15,000 bounty to anyone who could defeat YouTuber Technoblade in the tournament Minecraft Monday?

elements.title: Marble Hornets (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the symbol of Slender Man originates from the web series Marble Hornets?

elements.title: Sepp Kuss (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that cyclist Sepp Kuss logged 547,019 metres (1,794,682 ft) of elevation gain in 2023?

elements.title: Camp Lakeview (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Minnesota and Wisconsin National Guards may have shot cannonballs across the Mississippi River at each other during artillery competitions at Camp Lakeview?

elements.title: Destination of the Month (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Destination of the Month

Kowloon

One of the most densely populated cities on Earth, Hong Kong's mainland portion offers a culture less influenced by the British than the neighboring Island, plus accommodation, dining, and nightlife are generally cheaper.

elements.title: Off the Beaten Path (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Off the Beaten Path

Andorra la Vella

Andorra la Vella is the capital of a quirky co-principality lodged in the mountains between Spain and France that offers great skiing, hiking, and lots of duty-free shopping.

elements.title: Featured Travel Topic (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Featured Travel Topic

San Diego International Airport

The main airport to America's finest city is the busiest single runway airport in the world.
